issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

fields.summary: Fix NetApp Eucalyptus integration to work with Data ONTAP 8.3.x and ensure backward compatibility

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: EBS snapshots and volumes from snapshots fail against NetApp Data ONTAP 8.3.1

comments.body: Verified the fix against NetApp Data ONTAP 8.3 simulator using ebs and bfebs eutester tests

[~swathi]: Do you know if the shared-setup-1 is using the NetApp host with the version you are referring to?  If so, can I just create EBS snapshots/volumes on shared-setup-1 to test it?  This is the netapp info for shared-setup-1:
{code}
two.storage.blockstoragemanager = netapp
two.storage.chapuser = euca-one
two.storage.cloneretries = 600
two.storage.convertucode = on
two.storage.createucode = on
two.storage.enableautosize = true
two.storage.enablecompression = false
two.storage.enablededup = false
two.storage.enableinlinecompression = false
two.storage.enablespacereservation = true
two.storage.fractionalreserve = 0
two.storage.guarantee = volume
two.storage.initiatorostype = linux
two.storage.lunname = lun1
two.storage.lunostype = linux
two.storage.maxconcurrentsnapshots = 3
two.storage.maxconcurrentsnapshottransfers = 3
two.storage.maxconcurrentvolumes = 10
two.storage.maxsnapshotpartsqueuesize = 5
two.storage.maxsnaptransferretries = 50
two.storage.maxtotalvolumesizeingb = 500
two.storage.maxvolumesizeingb = 100
two.storage.ncpaths = 10.107.1.1
two.storage.noatimeupdate = on
two.storage.nosnap = on
two.storage.readbuffersizeinmb = 1
two.storage.sanhost = 10.109.1.26
two.storage.sanuser = vsadmin
two.storage.scpaths = 10.107.1.1
two.storage.shouldtransfersnapshots = true
two.storage.snapexpiration = 60
two.storage.snappercent = 0
two.storage.snapscheddays = 0
two.storage.snapschedhours = 0
two.storage.snapschedweeks = 0
two.storage.snapshotpartsizeinmb = 100
two.storage.snapshotpolicy = none
two.storage.snapshottransfertimeoutinhours = 48
two.storage.tasktimeout = 300000
two.storage.tryfirst = volume_grow
two.storage.uselargestaggregate = true
two.storage.volautosizeincrementinmb = 256
two.storage.volautosizemaxmultiplier = 3
two.storage.volexpiration = 1440
two.storage.vservername = euca-vserver
two.storage.writebuffersizeinmb = 100
{code}
If this host doesn't have the right version, how can I test this?  Thanks.
[~ccassler] - We don't have a NetApp with 8.3.1 Data ONTAP in the datacenter. We have to test this against the simulator. I might still have the simulator around, let me check and get back to you
[~ccassler] - I still haven't gotten around to setting up the simulator. I'll definitely try to get to it today
[~swathi]: I have a setup working now using netapp.  The CLC is @ 10.111.5.81.  Let me know when you have it configured with the simulator.

[~swathi]: I originally ran the 'euca-import-instance' command and there was not enough disk space to complete the command.  You added more space for me and I deleted some images to clean up space and tried again.  After trying again, the command completed successfully and I was able to see the new image, volume and snapshot.  However I did see some errors and it looks like a volume was created twice.  I then cleaned everything again and re-ran the command, I saw the same behavior.  There command and errors are shown below.
{code}
[root@a-39 emis-centos-6.7GnPWbXY]# euca-import-instance -t m1.medium -f raw -a x86_64 -p Linux -b gui-11409-test ./centos-6-2014-06-08.raw

[root@a-39 emis-centos-6.7GnPWbXY]# euca-describe-volumes
VOLUME	vol-6e983c79	5		one	available	2015-10-20T22:09:27.984Z	standard
VOLUME	vol-14b82819	5	snap-bc9026d3	one	failed	2015-10-20T22:57:42.617Z	standard
[root@a-39 emis-centos-6.7GnPWbXY]# euca-describe-snapshots
SNAPSHOT	snap-bc9026d3	vol-6e983c79	completed	2015-10-20T22:24:32.435Z	100%	000691342154	5

root@a-39 emis-centos-6.7GnPWbXY]# euca-describe-images
IMAGE	emi-8689dd79	000691342154/image-import-i-005bc583	000691342154	available	private	x86_64	machine				ebs	hvm
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	EBS	/dev/sda	snap-bc9026d3	5	false	standard
IMAGE	emi-eb547362	eucalyptus-service-image-1.41/eucalyptus-service-image.raw.manifest.xml	000691342154	available	private	x86_64	machine				instance-store	hvm
TAG	image	emi-eb547362	provides	imaging,loadbalancing,database
TAG	image	emi-eb547362	type	eucalyptus-service-image
TAG	image	emi-eb547362	version	1.41

[~swathi]: Based on the output above, I noticed that a volume from snapshot was attempted and failed.  I am manually trying another volume from snapshot and will post the results here.
I was able to manually create ebs images, snapshots, and volumes from snapshot so this is working.
